video.title: Scikit-Learn Course - Machine Learning in Python Tutorial
video.description:
Scikit-learn is a free software machine learning library for the Python programming language. Learn about machine learning using scikit-learn in this full course.

💻 Code: https://github.com/DL-Academy/MachineLearningSKLearn
🔗 Scikit-learn website: https://scikit-learn.org
✏️ Course from DL Academy. Check out their YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTgBlZ1fmNa87NUY1xvoxpg
🔗 View more courses here: https://thedlacademy.com/

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️

Chapter 1 - Getting Started with Machine Learning
⌨️ (0:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:22) Installing SKlearn
⌨️ (3:37) Plot a Graph
⌨️ (7:33) Features and Labels_1
⌨️ (11:45) Save and Open a Model

Chapter 2 - Taking a look at some machine learning algorithms
⌨️ (13:47) Classification
⌨️ (17:28) Train Test Split
⌨️ (25:31) What is KNN
⌨️ (33:48) KNN Example
⌨️ (43:54) SVM Explained
⌨️ (51:11) SVM Example
⌨️ (57:46) Linear regression
⌨️ (1:07:49) Logistic vs linear regression
⌨️ (1:23:12) Kmeans and the math beind it
⌨️ (1:31:08) KMeans Example

Chapter 3 - Artificial Intelligence and the science behind It
⌨️ (1:42:02) Neural Network
⌨️ (1:56:03) Overfitting and Underfitting
⌨️ (2:03:05) Backpropagation
⌨️ (2:18:16) Cost Function and Gradient Descent
⌨️ (2:26:24) CNN
⌨️ (2:31:46) Handwritten Digits Recognizer

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

kept getting this error: EOFError: Compressed file ended before the end-of-stream marker was reached 
any help?

replies.author: Sioax Aeriken
replies.text:
It turns out that the file just takes a very long time to download and makes it seem like the program hanged. If you give a few minutes the file will download. The reason you got the problem is because you canceled the download and it left a file with incomplete data which then failed to execute.

The command downloads 4 files totaling around 10mb. Not exacly a large file but I guess my network connection sucks or the algorithm limits download speed on their server.

replies.author: Sioax Aeriken
replies.text:
You can try deleting the file "train-images-idx3-ubyte". Search for it with your OS search feature because I use Linux and the directories very between operating systems.

I find that attempting to execute the code fails, then when I try to execute any other code it hangs. Kind of strange. I can't really continue this tutorial because of this problem with the mnist library. Seems bugged.

replies.author: Sioax Aeriken
replies.text: @Shubham Songire Oh, then your error w as similar to mine, but not the same. My error had the same message but an additional line with a compressed file name with "tar.gz" extension at the end. You may have to uninstall and reinstall mnist.

replies.author: Shubham Songire

replies.author: Sioax Aeriken
Shubham Songire
replies.text: @Sioax Aeriken thank you for your kind reply I have searched over the internet and found same solution as you said but it is not working

replies.author: Sioax Aeriken
replies.text: Look at your error. It should mention a file name. Search that file name to find out in what directory it is and delete it, then run the code again. You have to let the file download. It takes a few minutes, don't cancel your code execution it or you will have the same problem again.

topLevelComment.author: Liran Zaidman
topLevelComment.text:
Great video. 
3 comments please:
a. Use Pandas to make the results look like a nice readable table
b. In the linear regression, add also the p-values
c. In KNN and SVM show how to use the model for future data, not only the test part (i.e, how to implement it in SQL and/or BI program that is being refreshed daily).

topLevelComment.author: GooGoo Gua
topLevelComment.text: Thanks!!  1:14:00.. the logit function... I think it should separate y from 0 [instead of 1].  If you consider z= e^-y,  z would go from inf to 0,  crossing 1 at y=0.  So when y is negative, z gets bigger and bigger, and logit function would tend to 0; when y is positive, z gets closer and closer to 0, and logit function would tend to 1

topLevelComment.author: Jayson Faulds
topLevelComment.text:
I'm about 36 minutes in and they are not using LabelEncoder() correctly. LabelEncoder converts to 0, 1, 2, etc. by alphabetical order. Using the car data, high will equal 0, low will equal 1, med will equal 2, and vhigh will equal 3. This does not make any sense

Edit 1: For the SVM section, he has continuous features but he doesn't standardize them to a uniform scale. He should probably do that because it could skew the results

replies.author: Ali Onur Tepeciklioğlu
replies.text: He should've used OrdinalEncoder()
